Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
i will announce later today the method that will be used for early redeems. in order to qualify for this, your address needs to be uncontested and in the swept funds, you need to have filled out the form, and you will need your old compromised privkey to prove you had control of the address. if all these conditions are met and it isnt for a very large amount (size yet to be determined) then I will aim to get them processed before June 15th.

from what i can tell, the vast majority fall into the above category. i will use the blockchain to prove that the repayment has been made. after this first phase of repayments, the number of claimants will be much reduced, but there will still be a lot of KMD left to payout. the second phase will deal with swept funds that are big, but are uncontested. so make sure to fill out your form ASAP.

the third phase will deal with funds that were stolen. at that point all that will be left are the disputed addresses, which will be dealt with on a case by case basis.

the sooner we can complete the refund process the better, so my goal is to complete all phases other than dispute resolutions by the end of this month, but with vast majority of cases before june 15th. thank you for your patience.

Author: ninjanoel#2096
Content: So I've a question about the hack, I understand that the seeds were being sent too a remote location, but when the security team "used the hack" to preemptively sweep wallets, they could only mean they used the seeds stored at the remote location. So our hacker was smart enough to steal seeds but not smart enough to make his remote store not publicly accessible?

Author: ninjanoel#2096
Content: Cause they wouldn't be able to "use the hack" to re-intercept all seeds?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that gives him cover when he is found accessing that location, he can say he randomly stumbled into it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the location has been disabled by the destination site

Author: ninjanoel#2096
Content: So it was publicly accessible?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @DLT Novice we dont know what percentage we were able to get

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @ninjanoel theoretically, we had to decipher his obsfucated exploit to figure out where it was

Content: Ah, ok I get ya. Fair enough that makes sense üëç

Author: ninjanoel#2096

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: essentially, we hacked the hacker, but he is very patient. he spent months acting as a normal contributor

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and also didnt immediately cash in any large amounts, to prevent any chance of rollback
